lead_paragraph: Aaron Peirsol defeated Michael Phelps by 2.37 seconds to set a world record in the 200-meter backstroke last night at the Pan Pacific Championships in Victoria, British Columbia. Peirsol touched in 1 minute 54.44 seconds. Phelps, Neil Walker, Cullen Jones and Jason Lezak later broke the world record in the 400-meter freestyle relay, winning in 3 minutes 12.46 seconds.
